title: Generate and Edit Images with OpenAI's GPT-Image-1 Model
author: Edoardo Guzzi

"},"typeVersion":1},{"id":"42ccb29f-b820-4791-9683-4eb0f00ff2d3","name":"Sticky Note3","type":"n8n-nodes-base.stickyNote","position":[420,-320],"parameters":{"color":3,"width":280,"height":440,"content":"### âœï¸ Image Editing (OpenAI)
Sends the binary image to OpenAIâ€™s `/v1/images/edits` endpoint with a descriptive prompt.

- Model: `gpt-image-1`
- Format: `multipart/form-data`
- Requires a real file (not base64)
- Supports optional `mask` input

ğŸ“¥ Input: Binary image from `data`
ğŸ“¤ Output: Edited image in `b64_json`

Converts the edited image (`b64_json`) into a downloadable or previewable PNG file.

ğŸ“¤ Output: Final binary image
"},"typeVersion":1},{"id":"2b2533f8-b7aa-4499-970e-9b0546b73c0e","name":"Sticky Note5","type":"n8n-nodes-base.stickyNote","position":[-1240,-860],"parameters":{"color":6,"width":700,"height":980,"content":"## ğŸ§  Image AI Workflow Overview

This workflow uses OpenAI's image generation and editing APIs with the `gpt-image-1` model.

### ğŸ”‘ Requirements:
- You **must use your own OpenAI API key** from https://platform.openai.com/account/api-keys
- Create a credential in n8n called `OpenAi AIFB account` (or use your own name)

---

### ğŸ’° Cost Warning:
- This model is **powerful but expensive**.
- Each image costs **$0.020 to $0.190** depending on resolution and type.
- Always monitor your usage via the [OpenAI dashboard](https://platform.openai.com/account/usage)

---

### ğŸ” Why use `gpt-image-1`?
- Unmatched **semantic control**: you can edit specific parts of images with detailed prompts.
- Supports **multiple input images**, coherent edits, and future multi-modal tasks.
- Editing works with or without a transparency `mask`.

---

### ğŸ”§ Suggested Nodes to Expand Workflow:
- **Webhook** (trigger via your frontend or app)
- **Telegram / Slack** (prompt image generation from chat)
- **Set node** (inject dynamic prompts or user context)
- **IF / Switch** (change behavior depending on prompt type)
- **Merge** (combine multiple image generations)
- **HTTP Request** (send generated images to external APIs or CMS)

---

### ğŸ’¡ Example Use Cases:
- Marketing teams: generate product visuals on demand
- Designers: edit and re-style illustrations without Photoshop
- E-commerce: dynamic generation of themed mockups
- Content creators: create blog and social thumbnails in bulk

---

> âš ï¸ Don't forget to add rate limiting or batch controls if generating large volumes!
"},"typeVersion":1}],"pinData":{},"connections":{"Create image call":{"main":[[{"node":"Convert json binary to File","type":"main","index":0}]]},"Edit Image (OpenAI)":{"main":[[{"node":"Convert json binary to File final","type":"main","index":0}]]},"Convert json binary to File":{"main":[[{"node":"Edit Image (OpenAI)","type":"main","index":0}]]},"When clicking â€˜Test workflowâ€™":{"main":[[{"node":"Create image call","type":"main","index":0}]]}}}
readme:
This template integrates OpenAI's image generation and editing endpoints via the GPT-Image-1 model to visually create and manipulate images based on prompts. It features base64 conversion, binary handling, and prompt chaining.

Perfect for marketing, design, product visuals and creative workflows.

**ğŸ› ï¸ Requirements**  
OpenAI account with access to gpt-image-1(probably you need organizations verifications for access to that model)

OpenAI API credentials configured in n8n

A self-hosted or cloud n8n instance

Basic familiarity with the n8n UI (no programming required)

**ğŸ”§ Step-by-step Instructions**

Step 1: Manual Trigger  
Starts the workflow on click. Ideal for testing the generation and edit logic.

Step 2: Generate Image  
The Create image call node sends a prompt to OpenAI and returns a base64 image.

**Example prompt:**

A cyberpunk city at night with flying cars and neon lights

**Step 3: Convert to Binary**  
The base64 image is converted into a usable binary PNG file with the Convert json binary to File node.

**Step 4: Edit the Image**  
The binary file is passed to OpenAIâ€™s /images/edits endpoint. A new prompt applies changes to the image.

**Example:**

Add a glowing robot in the foreground with a neon sword

âœ… Supports model: gpt-image-1  
âš ï¸ Requires binary file (not base64)

**Step 5: Final Conversion**  
Converts the final edited image from base64 to file so it can be downloaded or used in other nodes.

**ğŸ¯ Real-World Use Cases**  
ğŸ¨ Artists & Creators: concept art and illustration variations

ğŸ›ï¸ E-commerce: auto-generate product mockups

ğŸ“° Marketing: create eye-catching blog or social visuals

**ğŸ’¡ Bonus Ideas**  
Add a Telegram or Slack node to generate or edit images via chat

Use a Webhook to feed prompts from a form or frontend

Add a mask to restrict edits to specific areas (e.g., background only)
